thread.title: New Zealand to bat first in Chappell-Hadlee finale against Australia
thread.title_full: New Zealand to bat first in Chappell-Hadlee finale against Australia

author: Ian Anderson
title: New Zealand to bat first in Chappell-Hadlee finale against Australia
text:
New Zealand to bat first in Chappell-Hadlee finale against Australia IAN ANDERSON Last updated 10:47, February 5 2017 PHOTOSPORT 
Lockie Ferguson has kept Ish Sodhi out of the NZ side to face Australia in Hamilton. 
New Zealand will bat first in the final match of the one-day cricket series against Australia in Hamilton on Sunday. 
Visiting skipper Aaron Finch lost the toss and Black Caps skipper Kane Williamson chose to bat at Seddon Park in the 50-overs a-side encounter which starts at 11am. 
In a surprise move, New Zealand didn't name Ish Sodhi in their XI; instead sticking with speedster Lockie Ferguson from the team that won a thrilling opening match in Auckland on Monday after adding Sodhi to their squad specifically for this match. 
The only change to the side from game one sees Dean Brownlie in as opener to replace the injured Martin Guptill - a change that was set to take place in Napier before the second match was abandoned. 
READ MORE: 
* Rival keepers keeping options open 
NZ lead the series 1-0 but have to win the third and final match to recapture the Chappell-Hadlee Trophy held by Australia. 
New Zealand: Dean Brownlie, Tom Latham (wk), Kane Williamson (captain), Ross Taylor, Neil Broom, Colin Munro, James Neesham, Mitchell Santner, Tim Southee, Lockie Ferguson, Trent Boult. 
Australia: Aaron Finch (captain), Travis Head, Shaun Marsh, Peter Handscomb (wk), Glenn Maxwell, Marcus Stoinis, James Faulkner, Pat Cummins, Adam Zampa, Mitchell Starc, Josh Hazlewood.
